<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
All right, <MYNAME>, look sharp, today's the
day!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Good morning, <MYNAME>. Miss Veronica
should be here any minute.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Good morning, Madam Eda. <MYNAME>.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, Madam Eda, the training week is over now.
How has <MYNAME> done?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
<MYNAME> handled just about everything I
covered. Sharp as a tack, this one!
<PAGE>
Felt like I had a second grandchild this week.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I see. That's good to hear.
<PAGE>
Well then, it looks like you've officially passed
your training with flying colors. Excellent work,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now that that's behind us, there's something we
must discuss.
<PAGE>
I want to tell you why we were seeking a new
farmer in the first place.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This town has grown thanks to its trade with
other countries.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>However, as things presently stand, we've
reached a plateau. Further growth seems both
difficult and unlikely.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Thus, we decided to invite a new farmer to town
-- as a breath of fresh air, if you will.
<PAGE>
We reasoned that having someone new who
increased our diversity of crops and livestock
would result in more products to trade...
<PAGE>
Which could lead to increased trade with our
partners and attract new partners. Everyone
would prosper from it.
<PAGE>
That's why we put out an advertisement seeking
a new farmer.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I don't mean to pressure you, though. I want you
to move forward at whatever pace you find most
comfortable.
<PAGE>
First and foremost, I want you to grow to love
your life as a farmer. Long-term satisfaction
goes hand-in-hand with success.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
<MYNAME> dearie, I'm sure you'll be a
successful farmer. Take your time and don't feel
like you have to push yourself.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh yes. About your farm, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Preparatory work has been finished, and it is
ready for you. Conveniently, it's right next door,
so you can move in today.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Ohoho! The farm next door is a good plot of
land. I should know, after all.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, <MYNAME>, allow me to show you
to your new home.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
As of today, this is your farm.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm glad to see you're excited about it.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Since you'll be living here, why don't you give it
a name?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Ah, that'd be lovely. Giving it a name will help
make it feel like home.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
<BLUE><MYFARM></BLUE> Farm? A wonderful choice of name.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
It has a nice ring to it.
<PAGE>
The farm's a little run down here and there, but
with a little TLC, it should be a cozy place in no
time.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm relieved you like it. Well then, let us take a
look inside the house.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
As of today, this is your house, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
I've taken the liberty of having everything you
used in Madam Eda's house moved over here.
<PAGE>
We've also provided you with a few pieces of
furniture, just to start you out.
<PAGE>
Now, I'm sure there are still things you'll need
here. This is, after all, a very old home.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Unfortunately, I'm afraid it falls to you to furnish
the rest of the house.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I will, of course, introduce you to a good
carpenter. He's quite skilled, so I'm sure you'll be
able to learn much from him.
<NAME_UNKNOWN> 'Ey, Veronica!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Well, speak of the devil. That's Gunther, the
carpenter I just mentioned.
<PAGE>
Gunther! We're inside. Please come in.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hey there. Sorry to keep you waiting. So, you're
the one who's gonna be living here, eh?
<PAGE>
This place has seen a lotta years. Solid
workmanship, but kinda dinky. No space for
stuff, neither. Best to start there.
<PAGE>
Arright! I'll show you how to renovate this place
yourself. First, we'll need some materials.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You'll need...
<BLUE>15 Small Lumber</BLUE> and <BLUE>15 Small Stones</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
Once you've got all that, come by my place on a
nice day between <BLUE>6:00 and 18:00</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
Oh, how 'bout this? Once we get your house
renovated, I'll build you a barn as a
housewarmin' gift.
<PAGE>
If you need materials, you can actually find
some on the street or in the forest. Righty-o,
good luck, then.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Gunther's house is <RED>surrounded by lumber and
materials</RED>, so you shouldn't have any trouble
finding it in town.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Good luck with your new life, <MYNAME>. If
you ever run into any difficulties, I'll do whatever
I can to help you out.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Now then, I have other business that requires my
attention, so I'll have to ask you to excuse me.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
To gather small lumber and small stones, you'll
need the right tools for the job.
<PAGE>
Here, you can have my old ones. They've seen
lots of use, but they still have plenty of life left in
them.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll put a few books on your bookshelf about
using your new hammer and axe.
<PAGE>
You'll always need a lot of stone and wood for
building, so it's wise to gather and store what
you can all year round.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
It was only a week, but I enjoyed having you
stay with me, dear. Thank you so much for
keeping me company.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Yes, I'm so glad you think so. Thank you again.
<PAGE>
I've put books about everything I've taught you
on your bookshelf...
<PAGE>
So if you ever run into trouble with your work or
have a pressing question about farming, just
head to your bookshelf and read up.
<PAGE>
Oh, I almost forgot.
<PAGE>
There's one thing in your new house that wasn't
in mine. That's your <BLUE>calendar</BLUE>.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The calendar lists the date and day of the week,
as well as any events coming up. It's quite
handy!
<PAGE>
The people of this town love going out, so there
are lots of events throughout the year.
<PAGE>
Keep an eye on which ones are coming up, and
attend as many as you can. I'm sure you'll have a
good time!
<PAGE>
The calendar will also list which days each
merchant will be at the Trade Depot.
<PAGE>
You've gotta pay close attention to that, dear.
After all, you can't ship anything when the
merchants aren't around.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, let me give you these <BLUE>turnip seeds</BLUE>
and this <BLUE>stew</BLUE> I made as housewarming gifts.
<PAGE>
I hope you enjoy the stew. Use the seeds to
grow the first of what I'm sure will be many
prosperous harvests.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Hoho! From one farmer to another, I'm looking
forward to having you as my neighbor.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Oh, before I forget! There were a few other
useful books I had, so I've put them on your
bookshelf.
<PAGE>
You should read 'em when you have a chance.
Now, here's your last allowance from me. Best
of luck, dear.

To renovate my house, I need...
<BLUE>15 Small Lumber</BLUE> and <BLUE>15 Small Stones</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
Once I have everything, I need to stop by
Gunther's house!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Are you sure you want to name your farm
<BLUE><MYFARM></BLUE>?
Yes

<CANCEL_SELECT>
No

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, what would you like to name it?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is <BLUE>Gunther</BLUE>. He handles all of the
construction in town.
<PAGE>
I've already told him a little about you and why
you're here.
I got <BLUE><MYFARM></BLUE> Farm!
I got <BLUE>6 Turnip Seeds</BLUE> and a <BLUE>Stew</BLUE>!
I got an <BLUE>Old Hammer</BLUE> and an <BLUE>Old Axe</BLUE>!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! How'd you manage to fill your bag
already? Try organizing it to make room for the
seeds and stew.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! It seems your bag is full. I'll put the
tools into your toolbox, and the rest into your
storage.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! It seems your bag is full. I'll put the
tools into your toolbox.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, let me explain how to use the
hammer and the axe.

Let's start with the hammer. You use a hammer
to collect stone. Equip it, then stand next to a
rock and <BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE> to pound it into
stone.

You can use the hammer to smash the boulders
that are lying around your farm, too.

Just like with rocks, you can pound away at the
boulders until you crush them into stone.
Boulders are sturdy, though, and it takes a lot
of effort to break one.

Next is the axe, which you'll use to cut lumber.
Equip it, then stand next to a branch and <BLUE>press
the A Button</BLUE> to chop it into lumber.

You can also use the axe to chop down the
trees that are growing on your farm.

Just like with branches, you can swing away at
trees to cut them into lumber. Trees can be
tough, though, and it'll take plenty of swings of
your axe to cut one down.
<BLUE>Using Hammers</BLUE> was added to your shelf.
<BLUE>Using Axes</BLUE> was added to your shelf.
<BLUE>Boulders on Farms</BLUE> was added to your shelf.
<BLUE>Trees on Farms</BLUE> was added to your shelf.
<BLUE>Making Friends</BLUE> was added to your shelf.
